meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irremovable.
meanings.sent1: The irremovabilities of the giant boulder made it impossible to relocate.
meanings.sent2: The irremovabilities of the stubborn stain frustrated the cleaner.
meanings.sent3: The irremovabilities of the sleepy cat from the couch led to a hilarious chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty to the company was an irremovability that anchored her to her job.
meanings.sent5: The irremovabilities of the ancient tree roots intertwined with the history of the land.

meanings.definition: The inability to be removed or taken away.
meanings.sent1: The irremovabilities of the heavy rock prevented it from being lifted.
meanings.sent2: The irremovabilities of the permanent marker left a mark on the whiteboard.
meanings.sent3: The irremovabilities of the stubborn sticker on the jar made opening it a challenge.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was an irremovability in his heart that stayed constant.
meanings.sent5: The irremovabilities of the old memories lingered in her mind like shadows.
